intro: Moquilea gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's moquilea, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, exhibiting a compact growth habit. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Moquilea gentryi is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
